markdownContent:
Based on your answers to the risk assessment form, your university administrators have flagged up your planned trip as “Potentially Dangerous (43% risk)”.

You may think that their reasoning—and bean-counting—is ridiculous, an example of the risk society gone mad, but there is only one way around the problem, namely pay an extra 199 EUR insurance premium to the university’s insurance company. You are not sure whether this will be counted as a “research expense”, but you hope so.

Do you want to continue with your travel planning or not?
